perturbation.original_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne
by equally by the parties. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of
California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any
provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne
solely by the franchisee. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of
California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any
provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction regarding who bears the costs of mediation. Originally, the costs were borne equally by both parties. The modified text shifts the entire financial burden of mediation to the franchisee. This introduces uncertainty and potential disputes regarding cost allocation.

perturbation.original_text:
You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your
rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code
20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.changed_text:
You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. This general release includes a waiver of all claims, known or unknown, against the franchisor. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your
rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code
20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence, 'This general release includes a waiver of all claims, known or unknown, against the franchisor,' directly contradicts the following sentences which state that California law voids waivers of certain rights. While the original text acknowledges the requirement of a release, it also acknowledges that such a release cannot waive certain rights under California law. The modified text attempts to enforce a broader waiver which is likely unenforceable, creating a legal contradiction and potential dispute.
